pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:0.5.eng: The training rule on slapping with the palm of the hand

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena dve bhikkhuniyo anabhiratiyā pīḷitā ovarakaṃ pavisitvā talaghātakaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:1.2.eng: two nuns who were plagued by lust entered their room and slapped their genitals with the palms of their hands.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:1.3.pli: Bhikkhuniyo tena saddena upadhāvitvā tā bhikkhuniyo etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:1.3.eng: Hearing the sound, the nuns rushed up and asked them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:1.4.eng: “Venerables, are you having sex with a man?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:1.5.pli: “Na mayaṃ, ayye, purisena saddhiṃ sampadussāmā”ti bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:1.5.eng: “No, we’re not,” and they told them what had happened.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:1.6.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:1.7.eng: “How can nuns slap their genitals with their hands?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns did that?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo talaghātakaṃ karissanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a nun slaps her genitals with the palm of her hand, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:1.14.1.comm: “Slaps her genitals with the palm of her hand” renders talaghātaka, literally, “Hits with the palm.” It seems from the origin story, however, that this was an indirect expression referring to the genitals. Sp 2.803 supports this interpretation: Talaghātaketi muttakaraṇatalaghātane, “Talaghātake: hitting the genitals with the palm of the hand.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:2.1.eng: Slaps her genitals with the palm of her hand:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:2.2.pli: samphassaṃ sādiyantī antamaso uppalapattenapi muttakaraṇe pahāraṃ deti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:2.2.eng: if, consenting to the contact, she hits her genitals, even with a lotus leaf, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:2.4.eng: if she does it because she is sick;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:2.6.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc3:2.7.eng: The third training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:0.5.eng: The training rule on the ending of the robe season

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarena upāsakena saṅghaṃ uddissa vihāro kārāpito hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.2.eng: At that time a lay follower had built a dwelling for the Sangha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.3.pli: So tassa vihārassa mahe ubhatosaṅghassa akālacīvaraṃ dātukāmo hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.3.eng: He wanted to give out-of-season robe-cloth to both Sanghas at the presentation ceremony for that dwelling,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena ubhatosaṅghassa kathinaṃ atthataṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.4.eng: but both Sanghas had already performed the robe-making ceremony.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.5.pli: Atha kho so upāsako saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā kathinuddhāraṃ yāci.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.5.eng: That lay follower then went to the Sangha and asked it to make an end of the robe season.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.7.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.8.eng: “Monks, I allow you to end the robe season.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.9.eng: And it should be done like this.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.10.eng: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.11.eng: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.12.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho kathinaṃ uddhareyya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.12.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should end the robe season.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.14.eng: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.15.eng: The Sangha ends the robe season.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.16.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati kathinassa uddhāro, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.16.eng: Any monk who approves of ending the robe season should remain silent.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.17.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.18.pli: Ubbhataṃ saṅghena kathinaṃ, khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṃ dhārayāmī’”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.1.18.eng: The Sangha has made an end of the robe season. The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.1.pli: Atha kho so upāsako bhikkhunisaṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā kathinuddhāraṃ yāci.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.1.eng: That lay follower then went to the Sangha of nuns and asked them to end the robe season.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.3.eng: But the nun Thullanandā, aiming to get robe-cloth for herself, blocked the Sangha from doing it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.4.pli: Atha kho so upāsako ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.4.eng: That lay follower complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo amhākaṃ kathinuddhāraṃ na dassantī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.5.eng: “How could the nuns not end the robe season for us?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.6.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tassa upāsakassa ujjhāyantassa khiyyantassa vipācentassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.6.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of that lay follower.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.7.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.7.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā dhammikaṃ kathinuddhāraṃ paṭibāhissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.8.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā block a legitimate ending of the robe season?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī dhammikaṃ kathinuddhāraṃ paṭibāhatī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.12.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī dhammikaṃ kathinuddhāraṃ paṭibāhissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.12.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.14.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.15.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī dhammikaṃ kathinuddhāraṃ paṭibāheyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:1.2.15.1.eng: ‘If a nun blocks a legitimate ending of the robe season, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.1.5.eng: A legitimate ending of the robe season:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.1.6.eng: a unanimous Sangha of nuns brings it to an end.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.1.8.pli: “kathaṃ idaṃ kathinaṃ na uddhareyyā”ti paṭibāhati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.1.8.eng: if she blocks it with the thought, “What can be done so that the robe season doesn’t end?”, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.1.9.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, and she blocks it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.1.10.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, and she blocks it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.1.11.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as illegitimate, and she blocks it, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.1.12.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she perceives it as legitimate, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.1.13.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.1.14.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and she perceives it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.2.2.eng: if she can show a benefit in blocking it;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.2.4.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.2.5.eng: The tenth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc30:2.2.6.eng: The third subchapter on nakedness is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:0.5.eng: The training rule on lying down on the same bed

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo dve ekamañce tuvaṭṭenti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.2.eng: two nuns were lying down on the same bed.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.3.pli: Manussā vihāracārikaṃ āhiṇḍantā passitvā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.3.eng: When people walking about the dwellings saw this, they complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo dve ekamañce tuvaṭṭessanti, seyyathāpi gihiniyo kāmabhoginiyo”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.4.eng: “How can two nuns lie down on the same bed? They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.5.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.6.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo dve ekamañce tuvaṭṭentī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo dve ekamañce tuvaṭṭessanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.14.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhuniyo dve ekamañce tuvaṭṭeyyuṃ, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:1.14.1.eng: ‘If two nuns lie down on the same bed, they commit an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:2.1.4.eng: fully ordained is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:2.1.5.eng: If two lie down on the same bed:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:2.1.6.pli: ekāya nipannāya aparā nipajjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:2.1.6.eng: if, when one is lying down, the other lies down, they commit an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:2.1.7.eng: If both lie down together, they commit an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:2.1.8.eng: Every time they get up and then lie down again, they commit an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:2.2.2.eng: if, when one is lying down, the other sits down;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:2.2.5.eng: if they are the first offenders.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc31:2.2.6.eng: The first training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:0.5.eng: The training rule on lying down on the same sheet

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo dve ekattharaṇapāvuraṇā tuvaṭṭenti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:1.2.eng: two nuns were lying down on the same sheet and under the same cover.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:1.3.pli: Manussā vihāracārikaṃ āhiṇḍantā passitvā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:1.3.eng: When people walking about the dwellings saw this, they complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo dve ekattharaṇapāvuraṇā tuvaṭṭessanti, seyyathāpi gihiniyo kāmabhoginiyo”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:1.4.eng: “How can two nuns lie down on the same sheet and under the same cover? They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:1.5.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:1.6.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo dve ekattharaṇapāvuraṇā tuvaṭṭentī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo dve ekattharaṇapāvuraṇā tuvaṭṭessanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:1.14.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhuniyo dve ekattharaṇapāvuraṇā tuvaṭṭeyyuṃ, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:1.14.1.eng: ‘If two nuns lie down on the same sheet and under the same cover, they commit an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:2.1.4.eng: fully ordained is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:2.1.5.eng: If two lie down on the same sheet and under the same cover:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:2.1.6.pli: taññeva attharitvā taññeva pārupanti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:2.1.6.eng: if they spread out just the one and cover themselves with just the one, they commit an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:2.2.1.eng: If it is the same sheet and the same cover, and they perceive them as such, and they lie down, they commit an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:2.2.2.eng: If it is the same sheet and the same cover, but they are unsure of it, and they lie down, they commit an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:2.2.3.eng: If it is the same sheet and the same cover, but they perceive them as different, and they lie down, they commit an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:2.2.4.eng: If it is the same sheet but different covers, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:2.2.5.eng: If it is different sheets but the same cover, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:2.2.6.eng: If it is different sheets and different covers, but they perceive them as the same, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:2.2.7.eng: If it is different sheets and different covers, but they are unsure of it, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:2.2.8.eng: If it is different sheets and different covers, and they perceive them as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:2.3.2.eng: if they make a partition and then lie down;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:2.3.2.comm: Sp 2.940: Vavatthānaṁ dassetvāti majjhe kāsāvaṁ vā kattarayaṭṭhiṁ vā antamaso kāyabandhanampi ṭhapetvā nipajjantīnaṁ anāpattīti attho, “Vavatthānaṁ dassetvā means there is no offense for those who lie down after putting an ocher cloth, a staff, or even a belt in the middle.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:2.3.4.eng: if they are the first offenders.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc32:2.3.5.eng: The second training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:0.5.eng: The training rule on making ill at ease

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī bahussutā hoti bhāṇikā visāradā paṭṭā dhammiṃ kathaṃ kātuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.2.eng: At that time the nun Thullanandā was a learned reciter, and she was confident and skilled at giving teachings.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.3.pli: Bhaddāpi kāpilānī bahussutā hoti bhāṇikā visāradā paṭṭā dhammiṃ kathaṃ kātuṃ uḷārasambhāvitā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.3.eng: Bhaddā Kāpilānī, too, was a learned reciter who was confident and skilled at giving teachings, and she was respected for her excellence.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.5.pli: “ayyā bhaddā kāpilānī bahussutā bhāṇikā visāradā paṭṭā dhammiṃ kathaṃ kātuṃ uḷārasambhāvitā”ti bhaddaṃ kāpilāniṃ paṭhamaṃ payirupāsitvā, pacchā thullanandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ payirupāsanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.5.eng: Because of this, people visited Bhaddā Kāpilānī first and then Thullanandā.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.7.pli: “imā kira appicchā santuṭṭhā pavivittā asaṃsaṭṭhā yā imā saññattibahulā viññattibahulā viharantī”ti bhaddāya kāpilāniyā purato caṅkamatipi tiṭṭhatipi nisīdatipi seyyampi kappeti uddisatipi uddisāpetipi sajjhāyampi karoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.7.eng: “These ones, who are supposedly contented and have few desires, who are supposedly secluded and not socializing, are always persuading and convincing people.” And in front of Bhaddā Kāpilānī, she walked back and forth, stood, sat down, and lay down, and she recited and had others recite, and she rehearsed.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.7.comm: Sp 2.941: Saññattibahulā; divasaṁ mahājanaṁ saññāpayamānāti attho. … Viññattīti hetūdāharaṇādīhi vividhehi nayehi ñāpanā veditabbā, na yācanā. “Saññattibahulā: the meaning is they are trying to persuade crowds of people during the day. … Viññatti: not to be understood as asking for things, but as making known by various methods consisting of reasons, examples, etc.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.8.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.8.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.9.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā ayyāya bhaddāya kāpilāniyā sañcicca aphāsuṃ karissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.9.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā intentionally make Bhaddā Kāpilānī ill at ease?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī bhaddāya kāpilāniyā sañcicca aphāsuṃ karotī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.10.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.13.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī bhaddāya kāpilāniyā sañcicca aphāsuṃ karissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.13.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.15.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.15.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.16.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā sañcicca aphāsuṃ kareyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:1.16.1.eng: ‘If a nun intentionally makes a nun ill at ease, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.1.8.eng: knowing, perceiving, having intended, having decided, she transgresses.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.1.10.pli: “iminā imissā aphāsu bhavissatī”ti anāpucchā purato caṅkamati vā tiṭṭhati vā nisīdati vā seyyaṃ vā kappeti uddisati vā uddisāpeti vā sajjhāyaṃ vā karoti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.1.10.eng: if, without asking permission, but thinking, “In this way she will be ill at ease,” she walks back and forth in front of her, or she stands, sits down, or lies down in front of her, or she recites, has others recite, or rehearses in front of her, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.2.1.pli: Upasampannāya upasampannasaññā sañcicca aphāsuṃ karoti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.2.1.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, and she perceives her as such, and she intentionally makes her ill at ease, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.2.2.pli: Upasampannāya vematikā sañcicca aphāsuṃ karoti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.2.2.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, and she intentionally makes her ill at ease, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.2.3.pli: Upasampannāya anupasampannasaññā sañcicca aphāsuṃ karoti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.2.3.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but she does not perceive her as such, and she intentionally makes her ill at ease, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.2.4.pli: Anupasampannāya sañcicca aphāsuṃ karoti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.2.4.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she intentionally makes her ill at ease, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.2.5.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.2.6.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.2.7.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.3.2.pli: na aphāsuṃ kattukāmā āpucchā purato caṅkamati vā tiṭṭhati vā nisīdati vā seyyaṃ vā kappeti uddisati vā uddisāpeti vā sajjhāyaṃ vā karoti,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.3.2.eng: if, after asking permission and not desiring to make her ill at ease, she walks back and forth in front of her, or she stands, sits down, or lies down in front of her, or she recites, has others recite, or rehearses in front of her;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.3.4.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc33:2.3.5.eng: The third training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:0.5.eng: The training rule on not having someone nursed

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī dukkhitaṃ sahajīviniṃ neva upaṭṭheti na upaṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṃ karoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:1.2.eng: At that time a disciple of the nun Thullanandā was suffering, but Thullanandā neither nursed her nor made any effort to have someone else nurse her.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:1.3.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:1.3.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā dukkhitaṃ sahajīviniṃ neva upaṭṭhessati na upaṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṃ karissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:1.4.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā not nurse a suffering disciple, nor make any effort to have someone else nurse her?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:1.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī dukkhitaṃ sahajīviniṃ neva upaṭṭheti na upaṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṃ karotī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:1.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā didn’t do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:1.8.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī dukkhitaṃ sahajīviniṃ neva upaṭṭhessati na upaṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṃ karissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:1.8.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā not do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:1.10.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:1.10.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:1.11.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī dukkhitaṃ sahajīviniṃ neva upaṭṭheyya na upaṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṃ kareyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:1.11.1.eng: ‘If a nun neither nurses a suffering disciple, nor makes any effort to have someone else nurse her, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:2.1.8.eng: a student is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:2.1.11.eng: Nor makes any effort to have someone else nurse her:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:2.1.12.eng: she does not ask anyone else.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:2.1.13.pli: “Neva upaṭṭhessāmi, na upaṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṃ karissāmī”ti dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:2.1.13.eng: If she thinks, “I will neither nurse her nor make any effort to have someone else nurse her,” then by the mere fact of abandoning her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:2.1.14.pli: Antevāsiniṃ vā anupasampannaṃ vā neva upaṭṭheti, na upaṭṭhāpanāya ussukkaṃ karoti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:2.1.14.eng: If she neither nurses nor makes any effort to have someone else nurse a pupil or one who is not fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:2.1.14.comm: The reason a pupil (antevāsī) is treated differently from a disciple/student (sahajīvinī/saddhivihārinī) is presumably because the former refers to the pupil of an ācarinī, a teacher, whereas the latter to the student of a pavattinī, a preceptor.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:2.2.3.eng: if she searches but does not find a nurse;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:2.2.7.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc34:2.2.8.eng: The fourth training rule is finished.
